net.cloud.mmo.event.task.voidtasks

Class CancellableVoidTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.mmo.event.task.voidtasks.CancellableVoidTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VoidTask
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountedVoidTask

    public abstract class CancellableVoidTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements VoidTask
    A VoidTask which can be cancelled (via the task itself). Any task can be cancelled using the Future returned from scheduling it. However, this class includes a cancel() method which can be called from within the execute() method of the task itself.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.concurrent.Future<?> ourFuture
      The future from scheduling the task

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submitImmediate(TriFunction<java.lang.Runnable,java.lang.Long,java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit,java.util.concurrent.Future<?>> func)
        Called when this Task is to be submitted immediately. Keeps a reference to the Future resulting from scheduling the task - so that the task may cancel itself.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancel the task. The task will either not be executed or will not execute again.
